BiblioData.Title: SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE COMPRISING ONE OR MORE INJECTING BILAYER ELECTRODES
BiblioData.Abstract: The subject invention provides systems and methods that facilitate formation of semiconductor memory devices comprising memory cells with one or more injecting bilayer electrodes. Memory arrays generally comprise bit cells that have two discrete components; a memory element and a selection element, such as, for example, a diode. The invention increases the efficiency of a memory device by forming memory cells with selection diodes comprising a bilayer electrode. Memory cells are provided comprising bilayer cathodes and/or bilayer anodes that facilitate a significant improvement in charge injection into the diode layers of memory cells.; The increased charge (e.g. electrons or holes) density in the diode layers of the selected memory cells results in improved memory cell switching times and lowers the voltage required for the memory cell to operate, thereby, creating a more efficient memory cell.

Claims.P: What is claimed is:
1. A memory cell, comprising:
a first electrode;
an injecting bilayer electrode comprising a first electrode layer and a second electrode layer; and
a memory element that couples the first electrode and the first electrode layer of the injecting bilayer electrode.
2. The memory cell of claim 1, further comprising a diode layer that couples the first electrode layer of the injecting bilayer electrode and the memory element.
3. The memory cell of claim 2, the diode layer comprises an organic material and the memory element comprises a controllably conductive media.
4. The memory cell of claim 3, the organic material for the diode material is one of a polymer, an oligomer and a low-molecular weight organic material.
